description: Emmanuel Macron arrives for a three-day trip and is expected to address Parliament later.
title: King says France and UK face 'complex threats'

description: There are high hopes for Macron's three-day visit, but how close can the nations really become given past mistrust over Brexit negotiations?
title: How King Charles is helping to 'reinvigorate' the shaken UK-France friendship

description: The Liberal Democrats table an amendment to the Football Governance Bill that proposes showing at least 10 Premier League a season on free-to-air television.
title: MPs could vote on Premier League free-to-air plan

description: The residents of the rural area where Erin Patterson carried out her crimes are still in shock.
title: 'It became pop culture': Inside the sleepy towns left reeling by the mushroom murders

description: Consultancy firm Interpath confirmed that it had been appointed as administrators by the company.
title: Maternity retailer worn by Kate enters administration

description: Jannik Sinner says he cannot accept his progress to the Wimbledon quarter-finals  "as a win" following Grigor Dimitrov's injury heartbreak.
title: 'I don't take this as a win' - Sinner on cruel Dimitrov blow

description: There has been concern that non-disclosure agreements have been used to silence those in workplaces suffering harassment.
title: Workplace misconduct and discrimination NDAs to be banned

description: A test message will be sent to smartphones on 7 September, after a previous test revealed technical issues.
title: Emergency alerts to be sent to UK smartphones

description: Spain have laid down a marker at Euro 2025 with 11 goals in two games - but what makes them so good, and do they have weaknesses?
title: 'Exceptional' Spain show adaptability -  but are they vulnerable?

description: Technology editor Zoe Kleinman explores the tensions between between humans and machines that were encapsulated at Wimbledon.
title: Why don't we trust technology in sport?

description: World number one Jannik Sinner says Grigor Dimitrov "deserves" to be in the Wimbledon quarter-finals, after the Bulgarian is forced into retiring with a two-set lead because of a pectoral injury in their fourth-round match.
title: 'This doesn't feel like a win' - Sinner through after Dimitrov retires hurt

description: John McEnroe takes your calls on Wimbledon so far with Tim Henman and Kat Downes.
title: Listen to 6-Love-6 with John McEnroe from Wimbledon

description: A devastated Grigor Dimitrov retires injured when two sets up on world number one Jannik Sinner in the Wimbledon fourth round.
title: Devastated Dimitrov retires injured while leading Sinner

description: Ex-Welsh secretary David Jones becomes the third former Tory to join Nigel Farage's party in the last two weeks.
title: Former Tory cabinet minister Jones joins Reform UK

description: Carlos Alcaraz's only defeats at Wimbledon have come to Andy Murray at golf - now Cameron Norrie aims to inflict another on the tennis court.
title: Alcaraz loses at golf - can Norrie beat him on SW19 grass?

description: At least 91 people are confirmed dead,  following flash floods in central Texas.
title: Flash Floods Devastate Texas

description: The newly discovered flying reptile is the oldest pterosaur in North America.
title: 200 million year-old flying reptile species found

description: It is the latest milestone in the ongoing outbreak of a disease that was once thought to be eliminated in the US.
title: Measles cases in the US reach 33-year high

description: The former Brazilian president is on trial for his role in an alleged attempted coup, which he denies.
title: Trump tells Brazil to stop 'witch hunt' against Bolsonaro

description: The Islamist group led a rebel offensive that toppled Syria's Assad regime in December.
title: US to remove Syria's HTS from list of foreign terror groups

description: Arsenal sporting director Andrea Berta holds face-to-face talks with Sporting in Portugal as the Premier League club move closer towards a deal for striker Viktor Gyokeres.
title: Arsenal close in on Gyokeres deal after face-to-face talks

description: Novak Djokovic breaks the "curse" of playing in front of former rival Roger Federer as he beats Alex de Minaur to reach the Wimbledon quarter-finals.
title: Djokovic breaks Federer 'curse' in battling win

description: CCTV footage shows the moment a lion leaps over a concrete wall before attacking a woman.
title: Watch: Moment pet lion pounces on woman in street

description: Tim Merlier pips Jonathan Milan on the line in a sprint finish to win a crash-marred stage three of the Tour de France.
title: Merlier pips Milan in crash-marred stage three of Tour

description: A man with a rifle and tactical gear was shot and killed by police after he opened fire in Texas.
title: One dead, officers injured in shooting at US border patrol facility

description: The streamer, real name Morgan Burtwistle, was later released and denies damaging the classic car.
title: YouTuber arrested over F1 car damaged at Silverstone

description: Bruno, a seven-year-old bloodhound, had found nine missing people and was once honoured by Italy's prime minister.
title: Italian 'hero' sniffer dog killed with nail-filled sausages

description: England have "got to" play Jofra Archer in the third Test against India at Lord's, says James Anderson.
title: England have 'got to' pick Archer, says Anderson

description: An Xbox producer faces a backlash after suggesting AI tools can help to deal wih the emotions that follow job loss.
title: Xbox producer tells staff to use AI to ease job loss pain

description: Watch as Novak Djokovic takes the break point against Alex de Minaur in the longest rally of the tournament during their fourth-round match on Centre Court at Wimbledon.
title: Djokovic gets better of De Minaur in longest rally of tournament

description: The umpire who officiated the match at the centre of Sunday's electronic line-calling controversy at Wimbledon is "having a rest day".
title: Umpire has 'rest day' after line-call controversy

description: Saba Edwards and Thelma Stober read the names of the victims, in an emotional tribute.
title: Watch as victims of 7/7 remembered

description: Footage shows how the banks of the Llano River rose quickly over the course of an hour.
title: Watch: Timelapse shows how suddenly Texas flood waters rose

description: Writer Raynor Winn denies allegations that some elements of her best-selling book misled readers.
title: The Salt Path author defends herself against claims she misled readers

description: Gordon, 51, and Marten, 38, both deny manslaughter by gross negligence and causing or allowing the death of a child.
title: Jury retires in Constance Marten and Mark Gordon retrial

description: Police are treating the death of Dr Fortune Gomo  in the city's Lochee area on Saturday as murder.
title: Friends 'heartbroken' after scientist killed in Dundee

description: Singer says tests following surgery to remove her breast show no spread of the disease
title: Jessie J reveals cancer operation success

description: South Africa’s Wiaan Mulder declares on 367 not out, passing up the opportunity to break Brian Lara’s record for the highest individual score in a Test innings.
title: Mulder declares 33 short of Lara's Test record score

description: Cierra Ortega's parents say it's been a "painful" week after posts emerged featuring a racial slur.
title: Love Island USA's Cierra leaves show after racism row

description: Former Wimbledon champion Pat Cash says it is "ridiculous" that the chair umpire could not call the ball out when the automated line call system failed due to "human error" during Anastasia Pavlychenkova's win over Sonay Kartal.
title: 'Computer says no!' - Cash on 'ridiculous' line-call controversy

description: Evidence shown in the trial of Erin Patterson has been shared by authorities after she was found guilty of murder.
title: Watch: The CCTV and audio used to convict Erin Patterson

description: The woman suffered a miscarriage after Stephen Doohan crushed pills into a syringe and gave her the medication.
title: Paramedic jailed for secretly giving woman drug to abort their child

description: A teenager, from Lurgan, is the youngest solo swimmer to complete the North Channel swim from Northern Ireland to Scotland.
title: Boy, 15 , becomes youngest person to swim solo from Northern Ireland to Scotland

description: As players ask the Grand Slams for more prize money, the chair of the All England Club suggests those questions should be directed to the regular tour events.
title: Who should foot the bill for tennis players' pay rise?

description: Maro Itoje returns to captain the British and Irish Lions against the Brumbies on Wednesday as Andy Farrell's Test team appears to take shape.
title: Itoje to face Brumbies as Test team appears to form

description: The F-35B landed in Kerala on 14 June after running into bad weather. It then reported a technical snag.
title: UK experts inspect fighter jet stuck in India for three weeks

description: Erin Patterson has been found guilty of murdering three relatives and attempting to kill one other, after cooking them a toxic lunch.
title: Watch: Australia's mushroom murder case… in under two minutes

description: The president said the levy will apply to "any country aligning themselves with the Anti-American policies of Brics".
title: Trump threatens extra 10% tariff on nations that side with Brics

description: Mauricio Pochettino could bring belief to his US side by winning the Gold Cup on Sunday but defeat may see pre-World Cup panic set in.
title: Is Pochettino delivering hope - or panic - to US after Gold Cup loss

description: The US president and Tesla boss were close allies before a dramatic falling out in recent weeks.
title: Trump calls Musk's new political party 'ridiculous'

description: Campaigners warn thousands of children could lose access to education if the plans are abolished.
title: Government urged to keep care plans for children with special needs

description: JNIM has emerged as the deadliest jihadist group in West Africa as armies struggle to stem the attacks.
title: How an al-Qaeda offshoot became one of Africa's deadliest militant groups

description: The Guardian and the Times lead with responses to a review of special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) provisions in schools
title: The Papers: 'PM facing fresh revolt' and 'dental deserts'
